SEARCH
Module com.example.clientscheduler
Package com.example.clientscheduler

Class MainController

java.lang.Object
com.example.clientscheduler.MainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The Controller class that handles all the functionality and events that occur on the main page of the application. This is a very robust class that is mainly used to add/modify/delete customers and appointments but also allows functionality for things ranging from dynamic table production with supplied database results to time conversion and appointment overlap (de)confirmation.

    • refresh

      public void refresh() throws Exception
      A simple method that is attached to the radio buttons that builds the results table dynamically and hide any previous displayed interface messages.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • onReports

      Method to simply close the main window and open the "Reports" screen.

      public void addCust() throws Exception
      Method to simply close the main window and open the "Add Customer" screen.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • modCust

      public void modCust() throws Exception
      Method to simply close the main window and open the "Modify Customer" screen. Also has a conditional to detect if the customer selection was null, display an error alert, then return to the main window.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • delCust

      public void delCust() throws SQLException
      Method to query the selected customer agaist the database and remove them from the database. After deletion, the dynamic table is built again and a "successful deletion" message is shown.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • addAppt

      public void addAppt() throws Exception
      Method to simply close the main window and open the "Add Appointment" screen.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • modAppt

      public void modAppt() throws Exception
      Method to simply close the main window and open the "Modify Appointment" screen. Also has a conditional to detect if the appointment selection was null, display an error alert, then return to the main window.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • delAppt

      public void delAppt() throws SQLException
      Method to query the selected appointment agaist the database and remove them from the database. After deletion, the dynamic table is built again and a "successful deletion" message is shown.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • logout

      public void logout() throws IOException
      Method to simply close the main window, log the user out of the system, and re-open the Login page.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • convertToUTC

      public static String convertToUTC(String input_time, LocalDate date)
      Helper method that takes in a military-formatted time and a date and converts them to UTC, typically for upload into the local database.
      Parameters:
      input_time - The given time parameter, as a String.
      date - The given date parameter, as a LocalDate.
      Returns:
      A combined datetime in UTC, as a String.

    • convertToEST

      public static String convertToEST(String input_time, LocalDate date)
      Helper method that takes in a military-formatted time and a date and converts them to EST, typically for display in the dynamic table or to check if appointments are within working office hours.
      Parameters:
      input_time - The given time parameter, as a String.
      date - The given date parameter, as a LocalDate.
      Returns:
      A combined datetime in EST, as a String.

    • convertToLocal

      public static String convertToLocal(LocalTime input_time, LocalDate date)
      Helper method that takes in a military-formatted time and a date and converts them to the user's local time, typically for display in the dynamic table.
      Parameters:
      input_time - The given time parameter, as a LocalTime.
      date - The given date parameter, as a LocalDate.
      Returns:
      A combined datetime in user's local time, as a String.

    • isOverlapping

      public static boolean isOverlapping(Date start1, Date end1, Date start2, Date end2)
      Helper method that takes in the start and end datetimes of two separate entries and has a conditional to first check if the dates are on the same day and return false if not or else it will compare the times to see if those overlap and return true if so.
      Parameters:
      start1 - The start of the first supplied appointment date.
      end1 - The end of the first supplied appointment date.
      start2 - The start of the second supplied appointment date.
      end2 - The end of the second supplied appointment date.
      Returns:
      Boolean of whether the two appointment dates overlap.

    • startBeforeEnd

      public static boolean startBeforeEnd(Date start, Date end)
      This method takes in a starting appointment time and compares it to the corresponding ending appointment time to verify whether the starting time is before the ending time for input validation purposes.
      Parameters:
      start - The start datetime of the supplied appointment date.
      end - The end datetime of the supplied appointment date.
      Returns:
      A boolean of whether the starting appointment time is before the ending appointment time.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Upon initialization, a dynamic table is built with the default selection of displaying all appointments.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - Standard Parameter.
